inspirationalQuotes.text: The good physician treats the disease; the great physician treats the patient who has the disease.
inspirationalQuotes.author: William Osler

inspirationalQuotes.text: Wherever the art of medicine is loved, there is also a love of humanity.
inspirationalQuotes.author: Hippocrates

inspirationalQuotes.text: The art of medicine consists of amusing the patient while nature cures the disease.
inspirationalQuotes.author: Voltaire

inspirationalQuotes.text: The aim of medicine is to prevent disease and prolong life; the ideal of medicine is to eliminate the need of a physician.
inspirationalQuotes.author: William J. Mayo

paretoBanner.title: Master the 20%
paretoBanner.description: Focus on the high-yield topics that make up 80% of your exams.

questionOfTheDay.question: A 55-year-old male presents with sudden-onset, 'worst headache of my life.' A non-contrast CT of the head is performed. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

caseStudies.title: Achy Joints and a Facial Rash
caseStudies.scenario: A 28-year-old female presents with a 3-month history of joint pain, fatigue, and a distinctive rash across her cheeks and nose that worsens with sun exposure.
caseStudies.question: Given the 'butterfly' rash and systemic symptoms, what is the most likely diagnosis?
caseStudies.explanation: The classic malar (butterfly) rash, photosensitivity, arthralgias, and fatigue in a young female are hallmark features of Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE).

caseStudies.title: Sudden Chest Pain and Shortness of Breath
caseStudies.scenario: A 65-year-old male with a history of hypertension and smoking presents to the emergency department with severe, crushing substernal chest pain that radiates to his left arm. He is diaphoretic and short of breath.
caseStudies.question: What is the most critical initial diagnosis to consider?
caseStudies.explanation: The patient's presentation of crushing chest pain radiating to the arm, diaphoresis, and risk factors (age, hypertension, smoking) is classic for an Acute Myocardial Infarction (heart attack), which is a time-critical emergency.

subjects.name: Anatomy
subjects.description: The study of the structure and relationship between body parts.

subjects.name: Physiology
subjects.description: The study of the function of body parts and the body as a whole.

subjects.name: Biochemistry
subjects.description: The study of the chemical processes within and relating to living organisms.

subjects.name: Pathology
subjects.description: The study of the causes and effects of disease or injury.

subjects.name: Microbiology
subjects.description: The study of microscopic organisms, such as bacteria, viruses, archaea, fungi and protozoa.

subjects.name: Pharmacology
subjects.description: The branch of medicine concerned with the uses, effects, and modes of action of drugs.

subjects.name: Forensic Medicine
subjects.description: The application of medical knowledge to the investigation of crime, particularly in establishing the causes of injury or death.

subjects.name: Community Medicine
subjects.description: A branch of medicine that is concerned with the health of the members of a community, municipality, or region.

subjects.name: ENT
subjects.description: A surgical subspecialty within medicine that deals with the surgical and medical management of conditions of the head and neck.

subjects.name: Ophthalmology
subjects.description: A branch of medicine that deals with the diagnosis and treatment of eye disorders.

subjects.name: General Medicine
subjects.description: The medical specialty dedicated to the diagnosis and medical treatment of adults.

subjects.name: General Surgery
subjects.description: A surgical specialty that focuses on abdominal contents including esophagus, stomach, small intestine, large intestine, liver, pancreas, gallbladder, appendix and bile ducts, and often the thyroid gland.

subjects.name: Obstetrics & Gynaecology
subjects.description: The two surgical-medical specialties dealing with the female reproductive organs in their pregnant and non-pregnant states, respectively.

subjects.name: Pediatrics
subjects.description: The branch of medicine that involves the medical care of infants, children, and adolescents.

subjects.name: Orthopedics
subjects.description: The branch of surgery concerned with conditions involving the musculoskeletal system.

subjects.name: Radiology
subjects.description: The medical discipline that uses medical imaging to diagnose and treat diseases within the bodies of animals and humans.

subjects.name: Anesthesiology
subjects.description: The medical specialty concerned with the total perioperative care of patients before, during and after surgery.

subjects.name: Psychiatry
subjects.description: The medical specialty devoted to the diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of mental disorders.

subjects.name: Dermatology
subjects.description: The branch of medicine dealing with the skin. It is a speciality with both medical and surgical aspects.
